testo.en:
The ###b###seventeenth###/b### edition of ###b###LPM Live Performers Meeting ###/b###is from###b### 12nd ###/b###to###b### 14th May ###/b###in the spaces of ###b###Tolhuistuin###/b### in ###b###Amsterdam###/b###.

###b###LPM###/b### ###b###2016 Amsterdam###/b### offers the unique opportunity to experience ###b###4 days###/b### of audiovisual performances, VJing, workshops, panel discussion, product showcases presented by ###b###more than 300###/b### ###b###VJs, audiovisual artists, new media professionals and thinkers###/b### ###b###from 40 countries###/b### all around the world.

Indeed this community of artists made the ###b###LPM###/b### ###b###2015 Rome edition###/b### a surprising event. We hosted###b### more than 300 artists###/b###, ###b###220 performances, workshops and showcases,###/b### recording an overall amount of ###b###39 participant countries###/b###.

 [http://liveperformersmeeting.net/files/2012/02/page_concept_reencode.jpg]

Thanks to the contribution of the ###b###European Community###/b###, in the latest years the ###b###LPM###/b### project was brought aboard, to produce many foreign editions as in ###b###Minsk###/b### (2011), ###b###Mexico City###/b### (2013), ###b###Cape Town###/b### (2013) and ###b###Eindhoven###/b### (2014) in addition to those held ###b###Rome ###/b###(2011-2012-2013-2015).

Again, this ###b###XVII edition###/b### seeks to promote the practice of live video performance, thanks to a rich and unpredictable program aimed at exploring different themes through new audiovisual languages, techniques and technologies.

The daily schedule of the event:

###b###15:00 to 21:00 Workshops###/b###

###b###15:00 to 16:00 Lectures and conferences###/b###

###b###16:00 to 18:00 Presentations of projects and products###/b###

###b###18:00 to 04:00 AV Performances and VJ / DJ sets###/b###

Vj, artists, designers, professionals and the general public will be involved in the manifold planned activities: from experimental ###b###audiovisual performances, architectural mapping###/b### shows, and DJ###b###VJ sets###/b### to ###b###workshops###/b###, ###b###roundtables###/b###, and###b### presentations###/b### of products and hardware, with a special regard for ###b###Free and Open Source###/b### projects. Meeting areas devoted to the ###b###interaction###/b### among the hundreds of participants will be the corollary for the whole duration of the event.

###b###To attend the meeting, participants must register by following the procedures in the "participate [participate/]" section of the website, by choosing from several subscription options###/b###. To give the opportunity to host as much performances as we can receive, the maximum duration of each show is 30 minutes. Registration is open until###b### April 24, 2016.
###/b###Through our ###b###12 years of experience###/b###, we were able to draw a conceptual map of the trends that have most influenced the creation of live video performances, and the program of this edition reflects and investigates these trends:


	 • ###b###Live Cinema###/b###: works performed exclusively live, capable of demonstrating a narrative and experimental approach; projects in continual tension between perceptive experience and performative act.


	 • ###b###Video Mapping###/b###: a technique of video-projection that can animate architectural volumes. The effect is spectacular and exciting, it confuses and seduces our perceptions through the dialogue among images and tridimensional surfaces.


	 • ###b###Digital Freedoms###/b###: activism and beauty, aesthetic database, data visualization of public or private data; these forms of artistic expression have been able over time to both inform and activate the consciences of people around the world.


	 • ###b###Visual gender###/b###: thanks to the critical tension among gender studies, queer theory and contemporary art, the vision of the body, the sexual identity is disconnected from the stereotype of LGBT and video language becomes an instrument of emancipation of the genre.


	 • ###b###Generative Visual###/b###: thanks to an encoding of the active and reactive world around us new digital biospheres offer to the public the experience of complex networks composed of simple sensory-bit binary codes.


	 • ###b###Stereoscopic 3D###/b###: stereoscopic vision allows three-dimensional display of standard video content for a complete perceptive immersion. Ad hoc software and technologies are used to manipulate the visual perception of space to create "augmented" worlds.

###b###LPM###/b### is designed as a place of dialogue, comparison and exchange of ideas and information between artists and fans in the field that are accustomed to meet, communicate and interact mostly in the virtual space of the network.

A real meeting place, a space that fulfills an important opportunity for dialogue and exchange, ###b###LPM###/b### encourages research, experimentation, the encounter between different forms of artistic expression, the interaction of multiple techniques and digital technologies, analog, software and hardware. ###b###LPM###/b### is an unmissable spectacle during which the audience has the chance to meet the world's largest selection of artists active in the field of live video performances.

The Meeting aims to promote transnational movement and exchange of ideas, artworks and artists. All funds recovered by ###b###LPM###/b### are invested to support innovative research and experimentation in the field of live visuals with the latest technologies. ###b###LPM###/b### is part of ###b###AVNODE###/b###, whose objective is to improve and promote the veejaying culture worldwide.

Realized in collaboration with international partners and co-organizers, the project includes a series of previews and promotional events focused on live video to be held inAustria, Belgium, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Spain, Turkey and United Kingdom, during the most important European festivals and cultural events.

###b###LPM - Live Performers Meeting ###/b###is part of the cooperation project###b### LPM 2015> 2018 ###/b###co-funded by the###b### Creative Europe ###/b###culture programme of the European Union, involving 14 events a year for three years, carried out by 13 partners from 12 countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Czech, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Spain, Turkey and United Kingdom.

###b###LPM###/b### is produced and organized by###b### Flyer Communication, Linux Club and FLxER.net###/b###.

testo.it:
###b###LPM  | Live Performers Meeting###/b###

Nato nel 2004, col proposito di rispondere all'esigenza di creare un ambito spazio-temporale di riferimento nel quale fosse possibile incontrarsi, conoscersi e condividere le esperienze legate al vjing, LPM è oggi un ###b###meeting internazionale ###/b###per artisti, esperti ed appassionati di ###b###veejaying###/b###,###b### visual ###/b###e###b### live ###/b######b###video ###/b######b###performance###/b###.

L'evento è caratterizzato da un ###b###programma ricco###/b### di ###b###performance video###/b### aperte al pubblico, eseguite in combinazione con le più varie forme d’espressione artistica, ed una serie di iniziative particolarmente dedicate agli ospiti del meeting.

###b###L'area "On"###/b###, consente al ###b###vasto pubblico ###/b###di assistere alle diverse applicazioni del ###b###video live###/b###, attraverso le###b### performance###/b### di ###b###artisti###/b### e ###b###gruppi ###/b###provenienti dal ###b###panorama internazionale###/b###, all'insegna di un'unica grande passione per il###b### ###/b###video, la performance e soprattutto il “live”. Da mezzanotte in poi ha inizio il ###b###VJ clash###/b###, in cui i videoartisti si alternano liberamente###b### ###/b###alle ###b###consolle video###/b### messe a disposizione, con ###b###numerosi###/b### ###b###proiettori ###/b###e ###b###monitor###/b###.

###b###L'area "Off",###/b### destinata al Meeting, occasione di###b### ###/b######b###confronto###/b### tra ###b###vj ###/b###e ###b###video artisti###/b### attivi nelle tematiche relative alle Video Live Performance, è concepita come spazio a sé stante, frequentato principalmente dagli ###b###"addetti ai lavori”###/b###, con un programma che alterna ###b###spazi d’incontro###/b### a ###b###workshop ###/b###e###b### showcase###/b### di progetti e prodotti.

LPM è uno ###b###spazio aperto###/b### alla ###b###libertà ###/b###d'###b###espressione###/b###, alla ###b###ricerca###/b### e alla ###b###sperimentazione###/b###; la flessibilità del programma, l'apertura verso nuove adesioni e contributi, la libertà di partecipazione e la possibilità di esibirsi nel corso della serata, ne sono una caratteristica intrinseca.

LPM individua nella ###b###sperimentazione###/b### uno dei capisaldi della propria ideologia; tutti i ###b###fondi recuperati###/b### sono perciò destinati al ###b###reperimento ###/b###delle ###b###tecnologie ###/b###più ###b###ambite ###/b###ed ###b###innovative###/b### a sostegno dell'evento e dell'attività di ricerca in ambito live visual.

L'affinità di ideali e le radici ideologiche comuni, hanno fatto si che LPM sia entrato a far parte dell'###b###AVIT network###/b###, la cui attività è finalizzata alla ###b###valorizzazione###/b### e alla ###b###promozione###/b### della ###b###cultura del veejaying ###/b###attraverso l'organizzazione di eventi a livello mondiale.

LPM è prodotto e organizzato da ###b###Flyer Communication###/b### (www.flyer.it), ###b###Linux Club###/b### (www.linux-club.org), ###b###FLxER.net###/b### (www.flxer.net) e ###b###FLV - Flyer Live Visuals###/b###, grazie alla collaborazione di importanti partner internazionali.
testo.en:
###b###LPM - Live Performers Meeting###/b###

Born in 2004, with the aim to answer to the need for creating a space-temporal referential field where to meet, know each other and share vjing related experiences, LPM is now an ###b###international meeting ###/b###dedicated to artists, professionals and passionates of ###b###veejaying, visual ###/b###and ###b###live video performance.###/b###

The event features a###b### full programme###/b### of ###b### live video performances###/b### open to the public, applied in combination with the most varied forms of artistic expression, and a number of initiatives particularly for guests of the meeting.

The###b### "On" area###/b### allows the audience to attend the different applications in live video through the###b### performances###/b### of ###b###artists###/b### and ###b###groups###/b### from the ###b###international scene###/b###, joined by a single great passion for video, performance and above all “Live”. From midnight onwards beginning the ###b###VJclash###/b###, in which video artists ###b###perform free ###/b###from video ###b###consolle ###/b###made available, with many ###b###projectors ###/b###and###b### monitors.###/b###

The###b### "Off" area###/b###, aimed at the Meeting, is an occasion of###b### confrontation ###/b###between###b### vj ###/b###and###b### video artists ###/b###working in the themes of Live Video Performance and is conceived as a separate area, frequented mainly by ###b###"insiders"###/b### with a program that alternates spaces ###b###meeting, workshops###/b### and###b### showcase ###/b###projects and products.

LPM is a space open to ###b###freedom of expression###/b###, ###b###research###/b### and ###b###experimentation###/b###; the programme flexibility, the openness to new members and contributions, the freedom to participate and the opportunity to perform during the event, are an intrinsic characteristic.

LPM consider the ###b###experimentation ###/b###a cornerstone of its ideology, and all the ###b###recovered funds###/b### are therefore allocated to ###b###finding###/b### the most ###b###desirable ###/b###and ###b###innovative technologies ###/b###to support the event and the research in the live visual field.

The kinship of ideals and the common ideological roots, allowed LPM to become part of ###b###AVIT network###/b###, whose aim is the ###b###enhancement ###/b###and ###b###promotion###/b### of ###b###veejaying culture###/b### by organizing events worldwide

LPM is produced and organized by ###b###Flyer Communication###/b### (www.flyer.it), ###b###Linux Club###/b### (www.linux-club.org), ###b###FLxER.net ###/b###(www.flxer.net) and###b### FLV - Flyer Live Visuals###/b###, thanks to the cooperation of important international partners.
Scenographer student at Academy of Fine Arts in Turin, I'm also a vj & videomapper freelance, who works in the main techno, tech-house events in Turin and Alessandria.

"Borders" is a vj set project that talks about the new borders which daily oppress us, and how we can escape these. Cities, cars, apartments and offices are constanly limit moving areas imposing frenetic and unnatural ritms to our lifes.
Only interpersonal relationships , music, dance, the free movement of the body and being closer to nature, can allow yourself to reconquer your mental and phisical space.
In "Borders" dancers,animals and flowers trample and reshape those prisons that we have to cross every day, turning them into simple background of new dreamlike adventures.

AVnode is an international network of artists and professionals organizing festivals and/or working in the fields of audiovisual live performances. The main goal is to join forces of local players, active on a European level on research and development of video art and audio/video live performances. 
AVnode will develop into a cultural umbrella association in 2012, being formed by a group of professionals and organizers of audio/visual art festivals from all over Europe.
The ability and experience accumulated by its founding members in years of work in the international scene of digital arts make the project a quality brand for all contemporary and future cultural productions that will be proposed under the AVnode label.
AVnode wants to establish itself as a formally recognized international organization with the aim to provide its members with funds, technical and cultural partnerships necessary for the achievement and development of projects and events such as festivals.
During LPM it will take place the third AV Node Meeting, after the previous already made in Berlin @ Transmediale Cafè and in Mannheim @ BSeite Festival 2012.

testo.it:
Crediamo che la cultura debba essere messa al centro del dibattito pubblico e considerata durante i processi decisionali.
Poiché è un componente essenziale per le società che vogliono forgiare una vita migliore per le generazioni attuali e future.

Crediamo che l'Europa possa essere la culla di una nuova società sostenibile e democratica.
Perché in Europa abbiamo tutti i beni culturali necessari. E poiché l'UE è il primo tentativo nella storia che mira a costruire una sovranità comune intesa  come un atto di pace e di rispetto per la diversità culturale.

Ci sforziamo di essere presenti quando si devono prendere decisioni che riguardano  l'Unione europea, gli Stati membri, i governi locali e regionali e le istituzioni internazionali.
Perché la cultura è una forza trainante per lo sviluppo democratico delle nostre società e per il benessere dei loro cittadini. Perché vogliamo fare sentire la nostra voce quando vengono prese decisioni che plasmano la nostra vita.

Lavoriamo per fornire un luogo per lo scambio di idee, di possibilità e dibattiti che possano migliorare la società e la nostra vita quotidiana.
Perché crediamo che molti di noi possono fungere da moltiplicatori per il nostro bene collettivo e individuale.

Stiamo passando dall'essere una organizzazione orientata ad un solo ambito a promotore attivo di tutto il settore.
Perché i diritti culturali sono diritti umani fondamentali e come tali dovrebbe essere intesi, difesi, avanzati da qualsiasi cittadino.

Vogliamo unire le nostre forze.
Perché siamo un gruppo di cittadini e di professionista impegnati, organizzazioni pubbliche e private che uniscono le loro forze per creare il mondo a cui vogliamo appartenere.
testo.en:
We believe that culture must be put at the heart of the public debate and decision-making.
Because it is an essential component for societies that want
to forge a better life for the current and future generations.

We believe that Europe can be the cradle of a new sustainable and democratic society.
Because in Europe we have all the needed cultural assets. And because the EU is the first attempt in history to build a common sovereignty as an act of peace and respect for the cultural diversity.

We strive to be where decisions are taken in the EU, member states, local and regional governments, and international institutions.

Because culture is a driving force for the democratic development of our societies and for their citizens’ wellbeing. Because we want to make our voices heard whenever decisions that shape our lives are taken.

We work to provide a place for the exchange of ideas, possibilities and debates that can improve societies and our daily life.
Because we believe that many of us can act as multipliers for our collective and individual good.

We are shifting from being a sector-oriented organisation to being an issue-driven one.
Because cultural rights are fundamental human rights
and as such should be understood, defended, advanced by any citizen.

We want to combine our strengths.
Because we are a group of committed citizens and practitioner, private and public organisations that join their forces to create the world we want to belong to.

International partners and representatives of the local cultural scene, are invited to debate and to identify the best strategies to help European artists and professionals to reach as many audience as possible across ￼Europe as to extend to underneath groups the access to more exposed cultural projects.

Yusuke Nakamura is a musician and composer based in Japan.
His music varies from R&B to electronica , and from abstract to commercial music. Recently he has performed with a synthesizer and a drum machine. 
He has done a lecture and performance at "NativeSessions" organized by "NativeInstruments".
He has released music internationally from SoulJazz(UK), IRMA(IT), SoundmenOnWax(US) and remixed Earth, Wind & Fire.
Vasko Vassilev, the concertmaster at London Royal Opera House has hired him as support keyboard player. 
Nakamura has performed a lot of music festivals and has released a solo album "ONN from IRMArecords.

I will perform the FingerDrumming and improvisation live set and play Electronica and Hiphop.
and I will play the bass in the right hand by hitting the pad with your left hand.

Atsunori Kihara a.k.a atnr is audio visual artist in Tokyo, Japan.

He was born in 1984 Hiroshima, Japan. He established post techno label “Denryoku Label” and formed live-techno band “Hiroshima Denryoku” in 2000. Since 2004 he started his carrier in Tokyo. In 2007 he released a CD album “agenda” from “Denryoku Label”. The song “Reach” which is included in the album got first rank in CRJ Sapporo Chart. In 2008, he took part in Live Performers Meeting at Rome, Italy as first Japanese player ever. In 2010, he released iPhone/iPad application “Hex OSC” and connection software ”OSCtoMIDI” from iPhone app developer unit SkyLight. In 2011 he provided a track “green breeze” to Mizukage Records Compilation vol.06. In 2012 he remixed a track by Nyolfen “Lunar Eclipse”.
In 2015 he performed in “Lost in karaoke” presented by Red Bull Music Academy as a experimental DJ unit Absolutely Amateur. And also he participated in Audio Visual festival “kaleidosoup” at Vietnam. Recently he sync music and generative visuals.

He takes part in the other projects as a keyboard player, arranger, sound designer and so on.
His music is influenced by electric, experimental, minimal and jazz.

He plays ambient, electric sounds. His method makes the sounds he created into numeric to generate visuals by FFT analysis.
The programs created by this method don’t project author’s intended visuals but accidental phenomenon.
Treating sounds as information or media and make it into visuals is his sound & visual live concept. Therefore every time he plays different sounds, the program results different visuals. Audience will experience irreproducible performance.

Laura is a visual arts lover dedicated to direct and produce live visuals projects and experimental pieces for commercial brands, art exhibitions and worldwide academic presentations. She produces herself and host her work under the name of "Optikal Ink Lab"  her AV laboratory and label.  

After many years working on advertising and TV as Filmmaker/producer, she found in 2008 the art based on video projection and light and she began to develop live performances and installations and to direct video mapping projects.   Since then she has lectured and performing as "Optika " in electronic art festivals like Mapping Festival in Geneva-CH, LPM in Rome, Vision'R in Paris and VJ University in Sao Paulo and her videos has been screened on sites such as the Art Museum of Rio de Janeiro and at the International Mobile Innovation Screening in Wellington/New Zealand. Laura also has worked as VJ in several parties and concerts next to renowned DJ's and bands in South America, USA and Europe, in clubs like "REX Club" in Paris,  "TRESOR" in Berlin and in cities like Bogota, NY, Budapest and Barcelona among others.

 As video mapping director she has designed large scales projects like the "AV Invader" in Bogota for 90,000 people during the Summer Festival with 140 m2 of video projection, the first made for this festival and the largest held in the city and recently in 2016 she designed, direct and produced a VIP stage area for Katy Perry concert in Colombia with a projected area of 480 m2., in addition she has collaborated in architectural mappings whit the international crew  "United VJ's" in the cities of Sao Paulo, Japan and Finland. 

Lately Laura has been working on intervention of public spaces in festivals like the "Nuit blanche" in Bogota, Led media Facade projects for the biggest tower in Colombia in honor of Colombian folklore, video guerrilla and LED installations including FullDome projections.

The South American AV field has gained a big internationally recognition due to its variety of digital and electronic art.
This lecture will shows the work of some of the most important crews and independent artists who helped to grow this community in countries like Peru, Argentina, Brazil, Colombia and Panama and even to establish art manifestos and new aesthetic lines when we talk about Live visuals, installations and video mapping.

Sex Trashart Attacks! Cybercat Maturbation! Unicorn deconstruction!
 
The mediaartist "Heidi Hörsturz" is working in the fields of audiovisual performance, video and soundart. Her work have been presented at international exhibitions, gallerys and art festivals. Her animations, live shows and installations combining contemporary art and modern trash aesthetics. She published a series of limited soundart vinyls and audiotapes which researches the connection of noise, artificial overstimulation and constructed visual associations.
One of the thematic emphasis of her work is the desire of the contemporary society to get more overstimulation in rapidly shrinking attention spans. The search for shocking informations and sexual content and the yearning for a colourful world tries to replace the current depression. The repression of self-reflection with audiovisual brain attacks represents a striving for an artificially constructed world. A digital orgasm that overlays the emotional relations to the natural enviroment.

Test Card is Manchester 's unique audio visual meet-up and is the brainchild of Sean Clarke, the Creative Director of Texture in Manchester's NQ. The aim of the project is to create a Community to explore the development of new software, technologies and techniques in the area of audio visual performance and interactive storytelling. Test Cards utilises Texture’s state of the art projection, audio and lighting system to provide a platform for artists to showcase their work.

"Conductor, is a VDMX and Ableton network based audio visual performance, between Test Card founder Sean Clarke and and Manchester based musician SGNL. Using psychogeography as a subject matter for the project, Sean explores space around the city by filming textural and architectural points of interest. Passing this footage over, SGNL then works with it and creates tones out of the space. The performance then becomes a way to explore the relationship between the visual and sound elements that represent that space, while also exploring the concept of dérive"

https://vimeo.com/161704649  - example

2016-05-12.titolo: Delirious Polyhedron / audio by SGNL video by Vj Pietrushka /

testo.en: SGNL is a Manchester based experimental electronica musician. He mixes live various sonic structures, very often making it almost a club sound. In his live performances SGNL's using Ableton controllers and mobile devices. His  He is a resident at Test Card, Manchester a VJ meet-up.

Vj Pietrushka / aka Maciej Piatek / is a video artist and filmmaker based in the UK. His work reflects a pure and authentic pursuit of visual experimentations. His video projections function sometimes not only as visual narratives but also as autonomous light beamers. Use of various video techniques such as found footage, collage films & VJing, has helped him to create an original mood & atmosphere around his live sets. His work has been screened & exhibited both nationally and internationally in places such as Arnolfini in Bristol, Babylon Cinema in Berlin, The Vienna Künstlerhaus and The Embros Theatre in Athens. Vj Pietrushka shared the stage with artists such as Isnaj Dui and Ben Nigel Potts performing fully improvised live vj sessions.

Delirious Polyhedron performance was inspired by abstract shapes physics. The idea behind this set comes from my work experience working with people with medical conditions such as: anxiety, delirium tremens. The abstract distorted polyhedrons reflects imaginative state of their minds. Also the whole set consist of common elements of Vj Pietrushka's previous sets such as: The Train Odyssey / Live Cinema set / -Through and Through footage.  The set was officially premiered at Test Card, Manchester on 29/01/16.

This A/V performance consists of pre-prepared 3D video samples made by Vj Pietrushka in blender, some found footage mixed alongside experimental electronica sounds played live by SGNL. The performance is fully improvised, two performers play along, the visuals are manipulated manually without  audio- reactive connection.

I make visuals to different events since 2007, moving on a wide range of  music genres and kind of venues. Festivals, clubs, outdoor events, theatres, cinemas, boats. From experimental generative mapping to mainstream festival vjing moving on a wide range.

Kate Orange is an electro pop singer producer and one of that new generation of DIY artists. 
In short her music is the mixture of pop, rock and electronic music, based on Ukrainian vocal melody and 80's inspired sound of Depeche Mode and Krafwerk.
Very often the udience compare Kate with Lady Gaga, and Róisín Murphy.
Main instruments: Ableton push, vocal, bandura.

“When I was a child and a teenager music always played at our home. My father played guitar and I pop-up at the stage for the first time with him when I was 5. We had a cool audio system at home and listened to Sade, Michael Jackson, later Kylie Minogue, Queen, Pink Floyd, who inspired me a lot and mainly these artists were my music teachers together with the classic music education”.
In the period from 2001 to 2006 Kate participated in vocal contests in Ukraine which she mostly won. In her native city Kherson Kate even got special award: “The Golden voice of Kherson”.
From 2006 to 2011 Kate actively performed in Ukraine as a singer and a vocal DJ visiting a lot of big cities.
In 2011 Kate moved to the Netherlands and immediately signed a contract as a DJ and producer with Inclusivo events which then organized events like “Hypnotize at the beach”, “Lashed”, “House religion”.
The same year she released her DIY electro pop album “Stereo Radio”.
The main single “Stereo radio” was featured in Madrid’s main TV channel Kanaal 3 with David Guetta playing it.
After this album and having ended the contract with Inclusivo Kate started to manage her solo career, mainly as a singer. 
In 2013 Kate performed mainly as a singer on Salinas at the beach by Melody production, Luxx
club in Rotterdam, Escape Amsterdam, Noxx - Antwerp and many more.
The same year she also became a finalist of Rotterdam Grote Prijs contest as a producer.
Year 2015 became a year of changes and music reconsideration.
Kate started to co-work with other musicians and built up the whole electro pop show which was kicked off to the audience in May 2015 in Rotterdam. 
Also, she graduated from the sound engineering department of SAE school . 
Summer 2015 was remarkable due to participation in “Taribush Kuna” festival in Drenthe, “Boodgike” festival in Veendam, “Make-A-Wish” project in Meerhoven and Sliedrecht.
In November 2015 Kate released her #WhisperMyName single together with social and charity campaign for kids with Down syndrome. 
Thanks to this song Kate Orange was featured in “Music Magic” - on omroep Almere (Almere’s radiostation), Zienester - Dutch music blog. Stozharu - Ukrainian magazine in the Netherlands.
Now Kate works on arranging a show tour across Europe in 2016.

Kate Orange together with Vj Yarkus presents audio and video performance which represents the best of Ukrainian and Dutch collaboration.
 Expect European music mix of pop, rock, electronic, anf folk together with the finest visual row.

L’Aubaine (Laurie Bender) VJ, visual artist, graphic designer from Geneva, Switzerland based in London. She performs Live Cinema, VJ and AV sets.

L’Aubaine started performing live visuals in 2005 while studying a master in Digital Arts in Barcelona. From her study she got interested in real-time performances and exploring different forms of narrative. 

All elements she uses in her work are self-produced, mixing different techniques, analogue and digital, as hand-drawn animations, illustration, typography, photography, graphical elements and videos. Her creation have that handmade feel, imperfect, bold and very very colourful. 

Laurie crafted her unique style over the years by superimposing layers, interlinking shapes and colours, mixing elements from different techniques in an unusual and elegant way. 
Her VJ sets are evolving compositions, audio-reactive, created live and flowing with the crowd and the music. Each set never look the same, she shares emotions, playfulness and she’s feels like a painter and his canvas.

In her Live Cinema projects, she expresses socio/politics/psychological concerns such as immigration, urbanisation and also travelling as a metaphor of an inner quest or as a journey. She uses a similar visual language as her VJ set made of text, videos, animations looped and layered. She usually works with an producer or musician for the audio side of her projects.

She collaborates and has collaborated with producers/musicians for live cinema, live visuals, music videos and graphic design in London with Diarmo, Visiting Cat from Basilar Records, Kria and Yaiza Varona and in Barcelona, Fernando Lagreca, E mc2 and Manintheattic.

L’Aubaine played in several festivals and events in Europe such as LPM (Rome, Eindhoven), Shambala festival (UK), Blissfields festival (UK), Hackney Wicked (London) Knockan Stockan (Ireland), Mostra Sonora i Visual (Barcelona), Fundub (Barcelona), Festival Femelek (Barcelona), etc.. and some of her videos were also shown in festivals and exhibitions such as Festival Vertical (Spain), Mostra Arte Digital, Caixa Forum (Barcelona), Festival Internacional de la Imagen (Colombia).

Abstract, organic, bold and very colourful. A story between lines and circles.

Set made of clips of hand-drawn animations, vectorial animations and other hand-made elements. No video, no 3D modelling. All the material used is self-produced. 

Superimposing layers, mixing elements, evolving compositions created live. Audio-reactive and flowing with the crowd and the music. 

Set up: 
Using Modul8 as the main software.
Madmapper to create different shapes and masks that I change during the set.
A video synth to create noise, lines and interesting colours effects.

As a VJ, he performs as an AudioVideo Live Act while he is also part of various production teams in electronic music. The main focus of his work lies in the exploitation of software failures, so called glitches, real time processing, live coding, machine learning as well as the direct interaction of sound and image.

The image generates music and the music then changes the image. This version of my series of Markov Chain performances is based on machine learning algorithms and live coding. The interaction of Audio & Video is highly improved and with impressive low latency. The artist, however, only gives the general direction and does not specify/determine the content.

Markov Chain #41 won "Best International AV Artist 2015" at the RadicalDB Festival in Saragossa, Spain.

NON_COCHLEAR MUSIC  |  AV Performance // Installation

Link: https://vimeo.com/153043641

What is non-choclear sound? 
They are the first words of a famous article, "On the non-choclearity sounds of Themselves", where dr. Malcolm Riddoch describes this kind of perceptual phenomenon. In summary, it refers at stimuli that affect, in part or completely, auditory perception without acoustic phenomena.

But where has this argument taken us?
That is, how this content can affect the art world, and, in this case, the music world?
If the sound, as sensation, can result from non-audible stimuli, even music, ment as the weighted order of sounds in time, it can be composed, entirely or partially, from non-cochlear stimuli.

This work is a musical composition, where music contents are split around different perceptual planes. This means that a single information, the music, is understood only merging the informations caming from all senses:

Acoustics Stimuli  
electronics sounds coming from differents speakers placed around the exhibition space. It's important to use sounds that encourage the multi-modal integration.  For example, it is not recommended to use sounds where the source is easly recognized or where consolidated languages are used, like melodies or speech.  The sounds must be a part of the context, and not the context itself. 

Visual Stimuli  
the same considerations made for acoustic stimuli could be applied to the visual domain: complex images or shapes could overlook the scene making difficult the multi-modal interpretation of music.  A good solution is use a simple white light. The intensity variation is interpreted as a movement in time domain, like the envelope of an acoustic sound. 

Tactile Stimuli 
This is the most important kind of stimulation, because the tactile sensations help modal integration processes.   The best way to transmit tactile stimuli in a large space is to use a suite of subwoofer speakers that send only sub-audio material, under 30Hz. This kind of frequencies create shockwaves around the space percepted with the body.

The technical environment used allows us to set-up the work as an installation, where music come from generative systems, or as a performance, where every stimul is the expression of the performer movement.

@Filippo Guida - Oct 2013

testo.en:
The project rises from my need to explore extemporarily the possible paths of a mental sound map I create with my imagination generated by the sounds I collect during my journeys into surreal soundscapes. Bites stolen from the real world, fragments of foreign and near musical traditions, impulses generated by the throbbing pains of subconscious creatures are all tiles of my vocabulary, which finds their place and interact with each other like in an unpredictable radiophonic flow.
The form of the performance are short journeys, portrait-like live sets, which focus on a specific aspect I choose to follow and expand. Their bonds are shown as extemporary discoveries, a sort of secret already contained in sounds themselves that I feel able to disclose to the audience.

This performance is about a ritual of sounds, gestures and images inspired by the chinese kung fu culture. The performer on stage unleashes muscular energy with his body that is absorbed and reflected by audiovisuals and light, like in an invisible fight between opposites. Will there be a winner?

l:ed is a group of artists currently composed by the picture slayer Dorianne Wotton and the soundsmith Exomène.
l:ed as in « l : Experiments in Digital »
l:ed as in « l : Exomène & Dorianne Wotton »
l:ed as in « l : Æsthetic of Desolation »

Along with their own works, the two partners Dorianne Wotton and Exomène are collaborating since 2004 around the concept of « æsthetic of desolation » their work extends to the areas of photo, music, video, digital arts and multimedia performance.
Their more recent works are « Synæsizer » (digital art installation), « Glitch-O-matic » (digital art installation) and « X-Peri-Mental » (audiovisual live act)

These recent works as they tend to involve new partners and artists made them create this group in order to facilitate the emergence and the shaping of new pieces of art.

This group aims to facilitate the creation of new pieces of art (especially multimedia and digital), to promote and disseminate them.
So l:ed is open to every person and institution in order to facilitate collaborations between its members and the completion of their projects.

l:ed est un collectif d'artistes actuellement composé par la massacreuse graphique Dorianne Wotton
et le forgeron sonore Exomène. 
l:ed comme « Experiments in Digital »
l:ed comme « Exomène et Dorianne»
l:ed comme « Esthétique de la Désolation »

En plus de leurs créations respectives, les « partenaires dans la vie, le crime et l'art » Exomène et Dorianne Wotton collaborent depuis 2004 autour de « l'esthétique de la désolation » dans des domaines comprenant, la photographie, la vidéo, les arts numériques et les performances multimédia.
Leurs travaux les plus récents sont : « Le Synesthèseur » (installation d'art numérique), « Glitch-O-matiC » (installation d'art numérique) et X-Peri-Mental (live audiovisuel).

Leurs récents projets, de plus en plus ouverts à d'autres partenaires et artistes, les ont conduit à créer ce collectif afin de faciliter l'émergence et la concrétisation de nouvelles réalisations.

Le collectif a pour ambition de favoriser la création, la promotion et la diffusion d'oeuvres artistiques multimedias, en particulier numériques et digitales. 
l:ed entend donc s'ouvrir à d'autres artistes et espaces, favoriser les collaborations et encourager l’accomplissement de ses membres et de leurs projets .

2016-05-12.titolo: Timelapse techniques for HD VJ footage production [€ 80]

testo.en: Owner of VJLoops.com that specializes in content creation, management and distribution.  Curator of over 40,000 media files and 450 artists from around the world.  Avid timelapse artist creating and editing content for stock footage industry.

Have you ever wondered how timelapses are created?  Would you like to know the tips & tricks used by the pros?  Kyle Lyons the creator of vjloops.com will spend 3 hours per day for 3 days teaching the basics of shooting your very first timelapse progressing to more advanced techniques like Hyperlapses (moving timelapse) and the Holy Grail technique (day to night).  The course aimed at beginners and those wishing to improve their existing knowledge will cover everything you need to know to get started, included are some important editing workflows that create stunning results.  On the last day take what you have learned and head out with Kyle to the streets of Amsterdam to start shooting your first timelapse!

THIS WORKSHOP ACCEPTS A MAXIMUM OF 20 ATTENDEES

PLEASE NOTE: 
< Suggested items for students to bring >
- Camera DSLR preferred, or camera with timelapse function
-Tripod
- Intervalometer (available for 10-15 euros on Ebay) Make sure model is compatible with your camera
- Memory cards capable of holding 100’s of high quality photos or RAW images. (Minimum 16GB recommended)
- Fully charged batteries
- Clothing suitable for the weather (we will be outside for extended periods of time)


PROGRAM - SUBJECTS COVERED

< DAY 1 / The Basics >

- Spotlight 
- Plan it! 
- Prepare your gear 
- Frame & Compose 
- Camera adjustments
- Frames & Frame Rates
- Interval
- Exposure
- Flicker
- Accessories
- Tips and tricks
- Workflow for Timelapse 

< DAY 2 / Advanced Techniques >

- Establishing Shots
- Transitions - holy grail
- Hyperlapses 

< DAY 3 / Practical >

Head out in the city to give students an opportunity to experience shooting timelapses with 1 on 1 assistance. Students will then be able to take the images they shot and apply the software techniques learned earlier to create a timelapse video. If students do not have cameras or equipment a free download of timelapse photos will be provided to allow students to practice the techniques.

- Standard Timelapses 
- Hyperlapse
- Day to Night

testo.en:
Traceland is an interactive video installation about tracing meta data and personal data adressing contemporary issues such as digital civil rights and governmental observation practices. We are still working on the documentation, feel free to register on the homepage to be part of the project with your data! http://traceland.7dex.de/

------------------

The walkable interactive installation "TRACELAND" simulates the interaction of individuals and metadata (and data bases) within the internet. It is supposed to illustrate the "everyday-traces" of personal information people leave behind using their onlinedevices, credit cards etc. -  a starting point for working with "big data" and behavioral prediction.

Via motion tracking, the movement of the participants (within the designated space) is digitally analysed and processed. The illustrative result of this processing will be projected on a large widescreen.

The installed kinect cameras will capture the participants. Then via back projection, silhouttes of the participants will be projected on the screen (in a slighly smaller scale than the actual persons being captured). The Silhouttes are not illustrated like a shadow (simply white), instead the silhouttes are visualized by a cluster of text (aka. meta and personal data) which is formed like a silhoutte of the individual person.

Futhermore the "silhouttes" steadily emit text fragments of internet data. When people stand still a fairly small amount is emitted and in correlation to their speed of movement, more and more text fragments will be emitted. The faster one moves, the more data will be emitted (just like you leave more digital traces when you use your online devices etc. at a high frequency).

Above the "data emitting silhouttes" (in the projection) there will be an abstract cloudlike
field of magnetic force, sucking up the data emitted by the participants (silhouttes),
mingling with it visually. Not only the speed of the movement of the participants will be analysed and processed. Also ducking down or strechting out will be valued. So if a participant ducks down, less data will be emitted and if one stretches out, more data will will emitted. This is supposed to visualize, that not only the speed (or frequency) determines the amout of data a person reveals but also the overall participation or non-participation in the digital world will lead to different results concerning the data that will be produced and stored.

The text fragments (metadata) the silhouttes consist of, as well as the emitted text
fragments are fictional, though based on average parameters of information people reveal on various occasions such as filling out online-forms, registering for specific websites, participating in social media sites, newsletter and others. Practically the data appearing in the installation/projection come from a databank which we will previously set up).

idea & concept by Morons of Motion
art direction: Yochanan Rauert
programming: Thomas Sanchez Lengeling

testo.it:
Il FLxER Team nasce nel 2001, attorno allo sviluppo del sotware FLxER, nato dall’idea di poter utilizzare un computer per realizzare una performance video live, similmente a ciò che accadeva già da tempo per la produzione/fruizione di musica elettronica. 

Poiché nessuno dei costosi software video “consumer” in commercio permetteva di esibirsi in tempo reale, la soluzione fu quella di progettare e sviluppare autonomamente un’applicazione che risolvesse il problema.

Su ideazione di Gianluca Del Gobbo di Flyer Communication e Alberto Bordonaro in arte vj b_muvis di Bluecheese, nasce, cresce, e si sviluppa FLxER, free-software interattivo nato per mixare sorgenti video, testi, grafica, immagini in performance video live.
testo.en:
FLxER Team was born in 2001 around the developing of FLxER software born from the idea of using a computer in order to realise a live video performance, similarly to what was already happening in the electronic music production/performance.

Since none of the expensive consumer video software available in the market did allow to perform in real time, the solution was to independently design and develop an application able to solve this problem.

Gianluca Del Gobbo from Flyer communication and Alberto Bordonaro a.k.a. vj b_muvis di from Bluecheese, gave birth, grew and developed FLxER, an interactive freeware designed for mixing video, text, graphics and images in live video performance.

Nel vjset un assaggio delle potenzialità del software open source unico nel suo genere.

testo.en:
Art has changed, now each of us is an element belonging to the second in which we connect with the artist, we get absorbed by your intentions and merge with its proposal, art moves us. But what moves to art? Definitely, it is not only ingenuity but also the technology that allows the artist to express his senses through his work.

Jose Carlos Reyna, one of the most representative visual artists from South America, has experienced this and we share the evolution of his work from the use of Modul8, the software that made it possible to develop volume and movement in his art pieces and spread the communication limits static or animated video designed to impact the public. Convinced that these tools are those that expand the creative possibilities of the artists designed a strategy to introduce this groundbreaking trend in his country.

Fascinated by this discovery, in 2015 José Carlos contacted with Boris Edelstein, creator of Modul8, and the result of this connection was a workshop for all visual artists of his country. They were two days in which artists from different cities came to Lima to meet and learn Boris Madmapper utilities, revolutionary software that allows mapping of more friendly and easy. What is striking about this was the 3D mapping workshop which performed the most representative of the Lima city archaeological site, Huaca Pucllana. This projection on the impressive monument was a clear sign that things are changing and where you least expect to find artistic performances that move us. Definitely, this was a defining moment for the Peruvian artists, because after this experience José Carlos Reyna stay in front of a group, composed of the best visual artists, with the mission of proposing and activate the visual art scene. Ver video https://vimeo.com/76829818

Back in Lima, the Visiones project was created with the idea of integrating the art scene and the general public platform to a traveling exhibition of digital art. To date, there have been three editions had much acceptance and concurrence of the public, there have been signs of international artists such as Bruno Ribeiro aka Nohista (FRA) and Sean Caruso (CAN) on Thursday July 16, 2015, Joanie Lemercier (FRA) and James Ginzburg (UK) on April 23, 2015, Maotik (CA) and Metametric (CA) on 26 February. All samples were screened in 360 full dome version 5.2 sound. Digital Planetarium in Chorrillos. From the next edition to reach more people and continue to promote the consumption of digital art in the new generations, the samples will be exhibited in a traveling dome 12 meters. Visit Visiones website www.visiones.com.pe or Video https://vimeo.com/channels/910601/132511280

Making a retrospective of the artist's work we go back to December 2013, when Jose Carlos conceptualized and developed the LIGHTBOMB, a controller box 54 LED channels. The unexpected was that an artist of Chile was the first to buy the first issue. Video https://vimeo.com/82566728

At that time, another facet of the artist looked at the best raves of his country, VJ GORILLA, the alter ego night with the one used to recreate fantastic settings, trace times, manipulated illusion, movement, light and leave all your viewers impressed. Since 2009, VJ GORILLA was that touched the senses of many fans of electronic music found its varied visual themes to flow.

In 2014, Jose Carlos participated in the Mapping Festival in Geneva City - Switzerland, where the global art scene took aim at the fashionista environment; the workshops were all about clothing for walkways LED. Upon returning home, he presented The Light Soldiers, a combination of dancers moving choreography and interact with another running simultaneously through their suits with LED lights Madmapper wireless control. View video https://vimeo.com/121565273

Jose Carlos Reyna is a benchmark of visual art in South America and always does its best to encourage access to the latest artistic and technological material, with a view to making all this will stimulate artists of his country. For each of them, engaging a large talented team, can salvage parts of Latin essence and record an identity that can be shared to the world.

As an artist, seeks to generate emotions and feelings through their facilities mapping, an important work is the lamp of pixels with a 270 bar system LED RGB 3D translated into 51 DMX universes, one of the projects maping dmx largest in the world made with Madmapper as control software installation, pushing the full potential of the program. Video https://vimeo.com/122337585

As an entrepreneur, UP CREATIVE, is the leader in production service company visual art pieces, being the main supplier of big brands who put full confidence in the work of Jose Carlos and his team of professionals.

The merit of Jose Carlos Reyna is in being self-taught, he established his creative bases at age 14, when empirically began to manipulate tools work of his father, who at the time was the art director of the leading newspaper in its country. From an early age, he entered the logic of software for graphic design and layout and discovered his passion for design; without imagining that was forming as a versatile artist.

An extra thing, as time passes the general public develops greater sensitivity, as well as the market starts to generate higher aesthetic and conceptual demands, therefore, José Carlos is developing the LIGHTBOMB 2.0 and continues to produce new workshop . One of its medium-term goals is the internationalization of VISIONS, to achieve introduce the best of Latin American talent in the global digital circuits. To contact the artist and resolve concerns about their work, we recommend reviewing your website.

We had the chance to work as a Vj, video mapping y stage design to artist like: Steve Aoki, Chucky, Luna City Express, Jimmy Van Em, Dj Uner, Matt Tolfrey, Christian Smith, Luca Bacchetti, Stefano Noferini, Tiefschwarz, Nathan Barato, Carlo Lio, The junkies, Shaded, Kabale und Liebe, John Aquaviva, Chus & Ceballos, Uto Karem, Technasia, Dave Seaman, Sebastien Leger, Chris Tietjen, Marco Faraone, Pirupa, Markus Fix, Julian Jeweil, Hobo, Hector, Gel Abril, Andy Martin, Ambivalent, Ilario Alicante, Edu Ibernon, Coyu, Re Dupre, Manuel de la Mare, Gaiser, Marco Bailey, 2000 & one, Secret Cinema, Heartthrob, Zeser Uysal, Format:B, Daniel Dubb, Rodrigo Laffert, Jay Lumen, Gabriel Ferreira, Olivier Giacomotto, Paul Ritch, Satoshi Tomiie, Alejandro Vivanco, Donavon Frankenreiter, David Herrero, Seth Troxler, Nick Curly, Layo & Bushwacka, Mirko Loko, Martinez, Chuckie, David Solano, Sick Individuals, Teemid, Sola Plexus, Thomas Young, Tony Jaxx, and festivals and parties: Far Away Festival, Road to Utra Perú, Holi Festival of Colours Lima, Sci Tec Peru, etc.

testo.es:
El arte ha cambiado, ahora cada uno de nosotros es un elemento que pertenece a ese segundo en el que nos conectamos con el artista, nos dejamos envolver por sus intenciones y nos fusionamos con su propuesta, el arte nos mueve. Pero ¿qué mueve al arte? Definitivamente, no se trata solo de ingenio sino también de la tecnología que permite al artista expresar sus sentidos a través de su obra.

José Carlos Reyna, uno de los artistas visuales más representativos de Sudamérica, ha experimentado ello y nos comparte la evolución de su obra a partir del uso del Modul8, el software que hizo posible desarrollar volumen y movimiento en sus piezas artísticas y extendió los límites comunicacionales del diseño estático o el vídeo animado para impactar al público. Convencido que este tipo de herramientas son las que expanden las posibilidades creativas de los artistas diseñó una estrategia para introducir esta tendencia vanguardista en su país.

Fascinado por este descubrimiento, en el 2015 José Carlos contactó con Boris Edelstein, creador del Modul8, y el resultado de esta conexión fue un workshop para todos los artistas visuales de su país. Fueron dos días en los que artistas de distintas ciudades llegaron a Lima para conocer a Boris y aprender las utilidades del Madmapper, un software revolucionario que permite hacer mapping de manera más amigable y sencilla. Lo llamativo de este workshop fue el 3d mapping que realizaron en el sitio arqueológico más representativo de la urbe limeña, La Huaca Pucllana. Esta proyección sobre el impresionante monumento fue un claro síntoma de que las cosas están cambiando y dónde uno menos espera encuentra performances artísticas que nos mueven. Definitivamente, este fue un momento decisivo para los artistas peruanos, ya que luego de esta experiencia José Carlos Reyna quedo al frente de un grupo, integrado por los mejores artistas visuales, con la misión de proponer y activar la escena del arte visual. Ver video https://vimeo.com/76829818

Luego comenzó a investigar más sobre las tendencias visuales en los principales ejes de intercambio cultural de Europa y Norteamérica y enrumbó por distintos países para contactarse con otros artistas e intercambiar ideas, técnicas y proponer alianzas que permitan integrar a Latinoamérica en esos escenarios. “Festivales como el Mapping Festival, Mutek y encuentros con instalaciones como las de Onion Skin de AntiVj, hacen de que piense que hay mucho por hacer en mi país con el arte digital. Y a nivel comercial, se pueden desarrollar propuestas con base en esta movida, ya que las empresas son conscientes de que este medio de comunicación es efectivo entre sus clientes y público objetivo” nos detalla el artista.

De vuelta en Lima, nace el proyecto VISIONES con la idea de integrar a la escena artística y público en general a una plataforma itinerante de exhibición de arte digital. A la fecha, se han realizado tres ediciones que tuvieron mucha aceptación y concurrencia del público, se han presentado las muestras de artistas internacionales como: Bruno Ribeiro aka Nohista(FRA) y Sean Caruso(CAN) realizada el jueves 16 de julio 2015, Joanie Lemercier(FRA) y James Ginzburg(UK) el jueves 23 de abril 2015, Maotik(CA) y Metametric(CA) el jueves 26 de febrero. Todas muestras fueron proyectadas en version full dome 360 con sonido 5.2. en el Planetario Digital de Chorrillos. A partir de la próxima edición para llegar a más gente y continuar fomentando el consumo de arte digital en las nuevas generaciones, las muestras se exhibirán en un domo itinerante de 12 metros. Ver web de Visiones www.visiones.com.pe

Algo que tenemos en claro es que José Carlos disfruta compartiendo y generando nuevos conocimientos, por ello, cada 3 meses está realizando workshops para actualizar herramientas y compartir experiencias entre sus pares. El ultimo workshop que realizó fue sobre Blendy Dome VJ y estuvo a cargo de VJ Spetto(BRA) & Roger Sodre(BRA), la sorpresa esta vez fue grande ya que artistas de otros paises viajaron para participar del taller. Ver video https://vimeo.com/channels/910601/132511280

Haciendo una retrospectiva del trabajo del artista nos remontamos a diciembre del 2013, año en que José Carlos conceptualizo y desarrollo el LIGHTBOMB, que es una caja controladora de LEDS de 54 canales, para uso exclusivo de Modul8 y Madmapper. Lo inesperado fue que un artista de Chile fue el primero en ofrecer comprarle el primer ejemplar, en paralelo, José Carlos le mostró el prototipo a Boris Edelstein, grabaron un vídeo explicativo del LIGHTBOMB y a partir de ello, se comenzó a comercializar principalmente en Europa. Ver video https://vimeo.com/82566728

En esa época, otra faceta del artista se lucía en los mejores raves de su país, VJ GORILLA, el alter ego nocturno con el que esta acostumbrado a recrear escenarios fantásticos, remontar épocas, manipular ilusión, movimiento, luz y dejar a todos sus espectadores impresionados. Desde el 2009, VJ GORILLA ha sido el que ha tocado los sentidos de muchos fanáticos de la música electrónica que encontraron en sus visuales temáticas variada para fluir.

En el 2014, José Carlos participó del Mapping Festival en la ciudad Ginebra – Suiza, donde la escena artística mundial puso la mira en el entorno fashionista; los talleres fueron todos sobre vestimenta LED para pasarelas. Al volver a su país, presentó The Light Soldiers, una combinación de bailarines que se mueven e interactúan con otra coreografía que corre en simultáneo a través de sus trajes con luces LED a control inalámbrico con Madmapper. Ver video https://vimeo.com/121565273

José Carlos Reyna es un referente del arte visual en Sudamérica y siempre hace lo posible para fomenta el acceso a lo último del material artístico y tecnológico, con miras a que todo esto sirva de estímulo para los artistas de su país. Para que cada uno de ellos, que engranan un gran equipo talentoso, pueda rescatar partes de la esencia latinoamericana y registrar una identidad propia que pueda ser compartida al mundo.

Como artista, busca generar emociones y sensaciones a través de sus instalaciones de mapping, una obra importante es la lámpara de Pixeles con un sistema de 270 barras LED RGB 3D traducidos en 51 universos dmx, uno de los proyectos de maping dmx más grandes del mundo realizado con Madmapper como software de control de la instalación, que empuja al máximo la capacidad del programa. Ver video https://vimeo.com/122337585

Como empresario, UP CREATIVOS, es la empresa líder en servicio de producción de piezas artísticas visuales, siendo el principal proveedor de grandes marcas que depositan plena confianza en el trabajo de José Carlos y su equipo de profesionales.

El mérito de José Carlos Reyna esta en ser autodidacta, él mismo estableció sus bases creativas a los 14 años, cuando en forma empírica comenzó a manipular las herramientas del trabajo de su padre, que en ese entonces era el Director Grafico del principal diario de su país. Desde muy temprana edad, entro en la lógica de softwares de diseño gráfico y diagramación y descubrió su pasión por el diseño; sin imaginar que se estaba formando como un artista polifacético.

Un dato extra, a medida que pasa el tiempo el publico en general va desarrollando mayor sensibilidad, así como el mercado empieza a generar mayores exigencias estéticas y conceptuales, por lo cual, José Carlos se encuentra desarrollando el LIGHTBOMB 2.0 y también continúa produciendo nuevos workshop. Una de sus metas a mediano plazo es la internacionalización de VISIONES, para lograr introducir lo mejor del talento latinoamericano en los circuitos del arte digital mundial. Para contactar con el artista y resolver inquietudes sobre su trabajo, recomendamos revisar su web.

En los últimos años he podido ser el encargado de los show visuales de Vj, video mapping y stage design para artistas como: Steve Aoki, Chucky, Luna City Express, Jimmy Van Em, Dj Uner, Matt Tolfrey, Christian Smith, Luca Bacchetti, Stefano Noferini, Tiefschwarz, Nathan Barato, Carlo Lio, The junkies, Shaded, Kabale und Liebe, John Aquaviva, Chus & Ceballos, Uto Karem, Technasia, Dave Seaman, Sebastien Leger, Chris Tietjen, Marco Faraone, Pirupa, Markus Fix, Julian Jeweil, Hobo, Hector, Gel Abril, Andy Martin, Ambivalent, Ilario Alicante, Edu Ibernon, Coyu, Re Dupre, Manuel de la Mare, Gaiser, Marco Bailey, 2000 & one, Secret Cinema, Heartthrob, Zeser Uysal, Format:B, Daniel Dubb, Rodrigo Laffert, Jay Lumen, Gabriel Ferreira, Olivier Giacomotto, Paul Ritch, Satoshi Tomiie, Alejandro Vivanco, Donavon Frankenreiter, David Herrero, Seth Troxler, Nick Curly, Layo & Bushwacka, Mirko Loko, Martinez, Chuckie, David Solano, Sick Individuals, Teemid, Sola Plexus, Thomas Young, Tony Jaxx, entre muchos más y en festivales y fiestas como: Far Away Festival, Road to Utra Perú, Holi Festival of Colours Lima, Sci Tec Peru, etc.

Visita: www.vjgorilla.com
Instagram: www.instagram.com/instagram
Facebook: www.facebook.com/vjgorilla

testo.it:
Marco Donnarumma (PhD) is an artist and writer. He merges sound art and performance art through science and technology. He creates performances, concerts and installations using and abusing human bodies, sound, infrasound, light, algorithms, body sensors and loudspeakers. His works rely on the material force of sound to produce intensely intimate encounters of bodies and machines, and vivid sensory and physical experiences. His creative process is a continuous feedback between artistic intuition, scientific experiments and development of custom technologies.

His latest performance, CORPUS NIL, creates a tense choreographic interchange between a performer and an autonomous machine using human bioelectrical and bioacoustic signals. 0-INFINITY is a monumental architecture of infrasound vibrations, audible sounds and high-powered lights morphing in response to biosignals and movement data from the visitors’ bodies. In OMINOUS and MUSIC FOR FLESH II he plays interactive music by amplifying sounds from his body. His installation NIGREDO induces visitors in altered states of self-perception by feeding sounds from their bodies back to their skulls and bones. The sculptural object SEPTIC physicalises digital viruses in the body. His action HYPO CHRYSOS immerses audiences in multichannel sound and video produced by the strain of his muscles while he pulled 50kg stones.

Regularly touring worldwide, he performed and spoke in over 50 countries across North and South America, Asia, Australia and Europe. His works are presented at leading art and music events (Sónar+D, ISEA, Venice Biennale, Steirischer Herbst), electronic art, sound art and performance art festivals (Sound Art China, transmediale, CTM, FILE, Panorama), research institutions (Stanford CCRMA, New York University, STEIM, IRCAM), historical music venues (Experimental Intermedia, Spectrum NYC, Café Oto, Mumuth Concert Hall, de Singel) and national museums (Museo Reina Sofia, CCCB Barcelona, Kunsthaus Graz).

The XTH Sense is an award-winning, free and open biophysical technology. 

During this hands-on workshop participants build manually from scratch their own low cost, biophysical muscle sounds sensor, and experience an intensive training on bodily performance of music, live video and other media. - http://www.xth.io/ -

>>> PLEASE NOTE: The kit of necessary electronic components will be provided by the teacher and it costs only 20 euro to pay at the beginning of the workshop. This price is not included in the entry fee to pay to LPM organization.

This class offers an hands-on experience and both theoretical and practical training in gestural control of music and bodily musical performance, using the XTH Sense. Participants build their own XTH Sense and learn how to generate interactive music or video from the muscle sounds of their bodies.

Developed by Marco Donnarumma, the the XTH Sense is a biophysical musical instrument enabling the creation of music through human bioacoustic sounds. It consists of a low-cost, DIY biowearable and an open source software to capture, analyse and process bioacoustic sounds from the human body. Muscle sounds are captured in real time and used as both a sound material to be composed live, and also as control values for sound and/or visual effects, live video editing and more. This enables a performer to play AV simply with the kinetic energy of his body, effectively replacing the need for a mouse, a MIDI controller, or the need to monitor one’s own laptop.

The XTH Sense is designed to be easily implemented by anyone, hence no previous experience in electronics is required.

First, participants are introduced to the XTH Sense by its author and led through the assembling of their own biowearable hardware using the materials provided. Next, they become proficient with the XTH Sense software by learning its features through practical exercises. They then develop a theoretical understanding of gestural control of new electronic instruments through a participatory critical analysis of relevant projects, selected by the instructor.
At the end of the class, participants are free to keep the XTH Sense they built, and the related software, for their own use.

The workshop is open to anyone passionate about sound and moving images. Musical or Visual background and education does not matter as long as you are ready to challenge your usual perspective on musical and video performance. Directors, Video Artists, Art Performers, Composers, Producers, Sound designers, Musicians are all welcome to join our team for an innovative and highly creative experience.

THIS WORKSHOP ACCEPTS A MAXIMUM OF 12 ATTENDEES

testo.it:
Musicista, produttore, sound designer. Comincia la sua carriera nel 2003 come chitarrista, nel 2007 inizia a sperimentare mescolando elettronica e sonorità acustiche.
Co-fondatore dell'etichetta Yalla Records, lavora come produttore a diversi album ed EP e scrive colonne sonore per video e installazioni.
Nel 2011 lavora alla produzione di svariati remix per alcune etichette americane, fra cui la neo-nata Beat Canteen, grazie alle quali si concretizza nel 2012 il suo primo tour USA, che porterà Sarc:o a esibirsi in diverse venues della west coast.
Nel 2013 vince il prestigioso Golden A'Design Award con il brano "Chasing Space", colonna sonora dell'omonimo video di Marco Bagni; e a seguire pubblica la sua prima raccolta ufficiale di colonne sonore dal titolo "Soundtracks Vol.1", seguita dall'EP "Something Happened" con la collaborazione del duo torinese Yellows. 
Numerose le partecipazioni a eventi e festival dedicati alle arti performative, fra cui LPM e RoBOt, oltre che serate in club e locali.
Nel 2014 produce il disco "Evoluzioni" per l'artista [FRAGMENTS], e “Downtime” per Torafugu.
Nel 2015 esce l’EP “Manifesto”, prodotto da Andrea Suriani (My Awesome Mixtape, i Cani, ecc.),  all’ Alpha Dept. Studio, che segna una svolta nelle produzioni di Sarc:o e avvia un nuovo percorso artistico.
www.iamsarco.com
testo.en:
Italy based musician, producer and sound designer. His career started in 2003 as guitarist, and in 2007 he begins experimenting mixing electronic and acoustic soundscapes. 
Co-founder of Yalla Records label, he’s been working as a producer on many records and composed soundtracks for videos and installations.
In 2012 his first USA tour after the release of many remixes for american labels such as Beat Canteen.
In 2013 Sarc:o has been awarded with the Golden A’Design Award for best music and sound design with the production of Chasing Space, soundtrack of the video by Marco Bagni (Lostconversation), and contained in the album “Soundtracks Vol.1” released in 2013. In the same year was released the EP “Something Happened” and started working on the production of two new full lenght albums: “Evoluzioni” for [FRAGMENTS] and “Downtime” for Torafugu, both released in 2014.
In 2015 Sarc:o released the EP “Manifesto”, a break-through in Sarc:o’s music.

Audio/Video performance based on interaction between waveforms and 3D elements.
A live electronic music small concert with acoustics and sampled instrument + a motion graphics 3D animated video narration.
The concept comes from the study of metaphysics and time-space in Luca Pozzi's art, the artist who inspired the video creations.

From the artist's statement:
"The space-time is an all-encompassing container, where everything is next to each other in a holistic sense. There is a strange feeling of frozen time. Past, present and future are indistinguishable. A series of multidisciplinary correspondences are converging into a beautiful network of pure and basic information beyond geographical, political and linguistic borders. The importance of the less intuitive aspects of our reality: quantum gravity, teleportation, entanglement, augmented reality, time travel, cosmology and biodiversity. The result of an unusual correlation between theoretical physics, informatics and contemporary art."

testo.it:
Over the years Mowgli has embarked in numerous visuals projects  including various audio-visual club nights like Sound on Vision,  Stylistik and The Nozzle and collaborated with various artists like  Darien J, Detwiije, The Tall Poppies and Silverio Funk. He has vjed  alongside electronic acts and djs like Greg wilson, Astrix and Infected  Mushroom and performed alongside Roisin Murphy, Tinchy Stryder and Lady  Sovereign at events ranging in size from the Big Chill Festival to  various underground clubs while also performing at niche AV events like  Immersion and Electrovision. He was a finalist at the 2008 Edirol  European VJ Challenge held at the London International Music Show ( http://www.ediroleurope.com/story_news.php?StoryType=WVJ&StoryID=EN_1215450950 ), shortlisted in 2009 for the Getty Images Mishmash competition ( http://mishmash.gettyimages.com/work/55AL6Q ) and had his holographic animation developed for the Musion projection system (http://www.vimeo.com/6561824 ) screened at Kinetika in London in 2010. 

Mowgli is an active member of the London VJ community and is currently  working on an audio-visual project and experimenting with video mapping.
testo.en:
Mowgli graduated in Scientific and Natural History Illustration at Lancaster University in 1996. Since then his career has been a journey through numerous design and artistic endeavours embracing all manner of traditional and digital media along the way, often collaborating with other artists.
He has exhibited paintings, drawings, furniture and audiovisual interactive installations while also producing live audiovisual performance and working professionally in the fields of lighting design, graphic design, illustration, web design, motion graphics, animation and vjing. He has experimented with numerous technologies including video mapping and holographic projection.
His artistic work has been shown at numerous international festivals, events and institutions including Kinetika Art Fair, the British Film Institute, LPM Rome, MUV Florence, Electrovision and Big Chill festival, receiving the Rite of Passage Award for his collaborative multi-media interactive installation reOnion at Burning Man 2011.
His commercial work has been commissioned by the likes of Coca-Cola, BBC, Nintendo and Apple while his vj work, which has accompanied world class music artists, producers and djs, made him a finalist at the 2008 European VJ Challenge at the London International Music Show.
testo.es: Durante los años Mowgli se ha embarcado en proyectos numerosos de las representaciones visuales incluyendo varias noches audio-visuales del club como sonido en la visión, Stylistik y el inyector y ha colaborado con los varios artistas como Darien J, Detwiije, las amapolas altas y el canguelo de Silverio. Él vjed junto a actos y a djs electrónicos como Greg wilson, Astrix y seta infectada y se ha realizado junto a Roisin Murphy, a Tinchy Stryder y a señora Sovereign en los acontecimientos que se extendían de tamaño del festival desapasible grande a los varios clubs subterráneos mientras que también se realiza en los acontecimientos del sistema de pesos americano del lugar tiene gusto de la inmersión y de Electrovision. Él era un finalista en el desafío europeo 2008 de Edirol VJ llevado a cabo en la demostración internacional de la música de Londres (http://www.ediroleurope.com/story_news.php?StoryType=WVJ&StoryID=EN_1215450950), puesta en la lista reducida en 2009 para la competición del Mishmash de las imágenes de Getty (http://mishmash.gettyimages.com/work/55AL6Q) e hizo su animación olográfica desarrollar para el sistema de proyección de Musion (http://www.vimeo.com/6561824) defendido en Kinetika en Londres en 2010. Mowgli es un miembro activo de la comunidad de Londres VJ y actualmente está trabajando en un proyecto audio-visual y está experimentando con el trazado video.

testo.en: An improvised experimental AV performance created with Mowgli's Zenoid Mk2 audiovisual groovebox. Created combining Ableton, Quartz Composer and Resolume, it delivers a wide range of musical styles with a nod to techno.

Holzhouse, a live Organic Electro project that incorporates as many acoustic instruments, environmental and Foley sounds or sounds taken from everyday objects as possible when recording the tracks. During a live performance, DJ Mo Fresh plays the so created samples while Pique plays the main melody and sings the vocals via looping station and Kaos pad, which leads to the possibility RTAD (real time audio deconstruction).

This way, the music of Holzhouse differs from normal house music in two ways: first, almost every sound traveled on air, is genuine and organic which makes the music sound more “warm” and “wooden”, much like Vinyl. Second, every performance is unique since it cannot be repeated the same way. To generate an experience that encompasses more than only one sense, Holzhouse found their visual counterparts in the Light-Art and Video Collective dORNwITTCHEN. Their concept: to intertwine both aspects, music and visuals, to seamlessly form an integral body. Through sound reactive visuals - as hard cuts and colorful images, creativity, art and science are affiliated with each other to reflect its own magical, playful and colorful world, the music interacts on the one side with the projections in real time and with live mixed videos on the other side. 

The used photos and videos are self-recorded and merged with digitally generated elements in order to present the music through visuals and light in its own, complete constellation.

audio-visual electronics: eye-catching and unorthodox danceable 

incite/ is the award-winning audio-visual electronics duo Kera Nagel and André Aspelmeier based in Hamburg.

Their immersive performances combine futuristic distorted bass music and outstanding visuals to an immersive synesthetic adventure, complex and inspiring.
Tightly synchronized greyscale HD-visuals oscillate between abstraction and semi-narration, inciting perception and awareness.
incite/ excites with an extraordinary information density and opens doors into the sphere of electronic image and music of the 21st century - a fascinating experience for ears and eyes.

The duo has produced six major audio-visual live sets until today: iconicity (2004), mindpiercing (2007), dualicities (2009), zoom studies (2010) holistic glue (2012) and beyond the entropic dimension (2015) and performed on many international festivals for media art, new music, electro, video art, rock and industrial, bridging the gap between digital art events and advanced club culture. 

incite/ was awarded several times for their productions (e.g. Qwartz Award 2012 (Paris - Qwartz Dancefloor), Visual Music Award 2012 + 2014 (Frankfurt - Visual Music Live Contest), 2009 +  2011 WRO Biennale).

2016-05-12.titolo: "Past, Present, and future of Fulldome & VR"

testo.en: Pedro Zaz (VJ Zaz) is a new-media artist, working internationally with projection mapping, TV, club-VJ, stage design, audio visual performance and as an artist in fulldome / immersive cinema. Pedro is also a director and one of the main organizers of the film festival FULLDOME UK. In the field of fulldome, he also works as a software mentor and systems integrator for VJing in digital planetariums.

A fun ride through the history of dome projections and Virtual Reality. Incredible and surprising  facts told by VJ Zaz.

It´s all around the 360º

VR or AR ?
360 x 180?
360 x 360?
 VJ in VR ?

What is Immersion?
How did we get here?
Is fulldome a new format for VJs?
VR and the Future of Fulldome...



Pedro Zaz (VJ ZAZ) is a new-media artist working with 360 VJ and fulldome,  video projection mapping, Television, club-VJ and audio-visual performance. He is the co-founder of  the internationally acclaimed video artist group United VJs  and the teaching platform VJ University, which provides specific art & technology knowledge around the world.   Pedro is a director and one of the principle organizers of the film festival FULLDOME UK. In the field of fulldome, he has also co-created the Blendy Dome VJ , a software for  VJing in digital planetariums.
